metadata.feature_description: Dynamically generates and manages thumbnails for files with configurable dimensions and versioning support

steps.expected: Images folder should display with files
steps.actual: Images folder displayed with multiple PNG and JPG image files

steps.action: Observe thumbnail display for image files
steps.expected: Image files should show actual image thumbnails in circular preview
steps.actual: PNG and JPG files (CTA-1.jpg, CTA-2.jpg, batch_image_3.png, etc.) displayed actual image thumbnails showing the content of each image

steps.action: Navigate to folder containing non-image files (XML, TXT, CSS)
steps.expected: Document files should show file type icons instead of thumbnails
steps.actual: TXT files showed TXT document icon, XML files showed </> code icon - no thumbnails generated for non-image files as expected

steps.expected: XML file should show code/document icon
steps.actual: Dnn.CKEditorSettings.xml displayed </> code icon instead of thumbnail, confirming thumbnails only generated for image formats

steps.action: Request thumbnail via API with width=200, height=200
steps.expected: Thumbnail should be generated at 200x200 dimensions
steps.actual: Browser title showed 'ThumbnailDownLoad (200x200)' - thumbnail successfully generated at requested dimensions

steps.action: Request thumbnail via API with width=50, height=50
steps.expected: Same image should be scaled to 50x50 dimensions
steps.actual: Browser title showed 'ThumbnailDownLoad (50x50)' - same image displayed at smaller size, confirming dynamic dimension scaling

steps.expected: API should return error for invalid file
steps.actual: API returned 500 error with message 'Object reference not set to an instance of an object' - system handles missing files gracefully

steps.expected: Secure folder should show lock icon and be accessible to SuperUser
steps.actual: Secure folder displayed with lock icon in grid view, SuperUser was able to access the folder

steps.expected: SuperUser should have access to view folder contents
steps.actual: Folder was empty but accessible - permission system working correctly allowing authorized access

observations: Thumbnails are only generated for image file formats: JPEG, JPG, PNG, GIF
Non-image files (XML, TXT, CSS) display file type icons instead of thumbnails
Thumbnails maintain aspect ratio - small source images won't scale up beyond original size
All generated thumbnails are output as PNG format regardless of source format
Secure folders are indicated by lock icon and respect permission settings
Missing/invalid file requests return 500 error rather than 404
